intro: Diapedium albicaule, commonly known as the white-stemmed diapedium, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite and oval-shaped, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Diapedium albicaule is often found in shaded, humid environments such as rainforests and undergrowth areas.
